etymologies: late 16th century. From Hellenistic Greek ἐπίικρισις determination, judgement from ancient Greek ἐπικρίνειν to decide, determine (ἐπι- + κρίνειν to decide, judge) + -σις

definitions: The rhetorical device by which a speaker proceeds to comment on a passage which he or she has just quoted.
A critical review, summary, or discussion of a case, condition, or body of research.
